pull.title: BIP3: Rename Created to Assigned
pull.body: Renames the “Created” header to “Assigned” to better reflect the meaning of the date held in this header field.

verification.payload:
tree 375e323a887ae5b782e45c6f54136ff2b3b10468
parent 869fd7765fcb2a5899a9f4d166e4df6f65e8c771
author Murch <murch@murch.one> 1758059432 -0700
committer Murch <murch@murch.one> 1758225030 -0700

BIP3: Rename Created to Assigned

events.body: Sorry for such a late join, but wouldn't "date of number assignment" be "numbered" rather than "assigned"?

> Sorry for such a late join, but wouldn't "date of number assignment" be "numbered" rather than "assigned"?

Thanks @katesalazar for the suggestion. Discussed your question with Murch offline, and I think the only clear improvement over "assigned" would be a phrase that includes the word “date”, e.g., assignment date, date of number assignment, etc.

For now, we'll leave it as-is, and it can be improved later, if desired (for instance, after #1820).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -119,7 +119,7 @@ appear in the following order. Headers marked with "\*" are optional. All other
 * Deputies: <Deputies’ names and email addresses>
   Status: <Draft | Complete | Deployed | Closed>
   Type: <Specification | Informational | Process>
-  Created: <Date of number assignment (yyyy-mm-dd), or "?">
+  Assigned: <Date of number assignment (yyyy-mm-dd), or "?">
comments.body:
nit, this is described in line 149 below, but it costs only two words here to make the prescribed values clear at first glance without searching for further context

```suggestion
  Assigned: <Date of number assignment (yyyy-mm-dd), or "?" before assignment>
```

-  Created: <Date of number assignment (yyyy-mm-dd), or "?">

comments.body: Would it also be acceptable (or preferable) to leave no value prior to assignment? e.g. `Assigned:`

comments.body: Note that `scripts/buildtable.pl` will need to be updated when this change is made across the BIPs.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -119,7 +119,7 @@ appear in the following order. Headers marked with "\*" are optional. All other
 * Deputies: <Deputies’ names and email addresses>
   Status: <Draft | Complete | Deployed | Closed>
   Type: <Specification | Informational | Process>
-  Created: <Date of number assignment (yyyy-mm-dd), or "?">
+  Assigned: <Date of number assignment (yyyy-mm-dd), or "?">
comments.body:
Thanks, I will be adding that to #1820.

> Would it also be acceptable (or preferable) to leave no value prior to assignment? e.g. `Assigned:`

I think I would prefer it to have a value, but the preference is weakly held.

@@ -613,6 +615,12 @@ feedback, and helpful comments.
 
 ## Rationale
 
+[^assigned]: **Why was the Created header renamed to Assigned?**
comments.body:

[^assigned]: **Why was the Created header renamed to Assigned?**
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -545,6 +546,7 @@ mentioned in the [Changelog](#changelog) section.
 - The optional "Version" header is introduced.
 - The "Discussions-To" header is dropped as it has never been used in any BIP.
 - The "License-Code" header has been sunset, as it was used by only five BIPs (98, 116, 117, 330, 340) and created more ambiguity than clarity.
+- The "Created" header was renamed to "Assigned" as the header’s value is the date of number assignment.[^assigned]
comments.body:
```suggestion
- The "Created" header is renamed to "Assigned", as the header’s value is the date of number assignment.[^assigned]
```

Edit: also for the "Discussions-To" line just above, s/dropped as/dropped, as/

Edit: could try to use the same verb tense throughout this section (present tense or past tense, e.g., "is" vs "was")

comments.body:
👍 

Worth mentioning no leading placeholder zeros (as the filenames do have them)?

```suggestion
  BIP: <BIP number (without leading zeros), or "?" before assignment>
```

comments.body: Double space at the end of a line is markdown for linebreak, which puts the response on a separate line from the question.
